2. Business Continuity plan
A company or entity needs to ensure that it has sufficient funds to perform business operations whenever the threat of a natural disaster, economic crisis or other unforeseen event threatens. This is accomplished through an internal business continuity plan ( BCC ). The plan consists of detailed tasks to perform daily at fixed intervals.
The three main steps of the BCC function are to identify what is needed to perform day-to-day operations in the organization; to devise the process for accomplishing these duties; and to identify any risks that may affect the mission of the company. By following these three steps, organization can ensure their business continuity from a disaster.

What is Contract Law?
Contract law examines the validity and enforceability of a contract. It regulates the terms of agreements between two parties, including any obligations or entitlements under the contract. It provides for issues such as the performance of contract and the consequences of an illegal agreement. Most organizations use contract law to protect their rights when they enter into contractual dealings to accomplish a specific business or project.
A contract is a legally binding or enforceable agreement between two or more parties that involves some form of exchange, such as exchanging ownership or services. In the context of business, a contract is generally considered to be an agreement to use a specific service or product under a certain license or agreement. What Does Arbitration Mean?
Arbitration is an alternative dispute resolution tool that is also widely used in some legal jurisdictions. It involves a third party, known as a “counsel”, representing one or more parties to a litigation case and making formal presentations to the court about the merits of the case.
Arbitration involves a court of law and the parties to the lawsuit to make formal presentations called “arbitration sessions”, which are usually held once per year in the United States and Europe. It involves the party against whom the case is being contested making formal presentations about its merits in preparation for an appeal, and once this process is completed, the case proceeds to adjudication. In Australia, it uses a process called the Court-Appointed Arbitrator

It may be used to make arrangements for financing or to deal with liability issues. Arbitration may also be a good solution for a dispute resulting from miscommunications, lawsuits, or other kinds of ambiguity.

What is a binding arbitration action?
Binding arbitration is a contract between two parties and an arbitrator. They agree to resolve their dispute through an arbitration by issuing a binding verdict that is binding on both parties. Once the award has been signed, it must be enforced orally by the arbitrator. Binding arbitration enables parties to have certainty that someone will resolve their dispute without being forced. Non-binding arbitration also gives each party an opportunity to make their case before an arbitrator. All disputes must be evaluated by both parties before either can respond to the other’s arbitration.

Contract of Assignment
In contract of assignment, an organization may allocate its own work to one person. The person responsible for the assignment assumes the duties of responsibility to perform the assigned function, but the other person shall assume all the responsibilities and be responsible for the fulfillment of the assigned duties. Thus, without a contract of assignment, the obligation to perform the assigned function of the organization is not formed. Although the assignment of work has been done, the responsibility for carrying out the assigned function is still held by the organization. All obligations related to the assigned work will be determined by the contract of assignment.

This type of agreement provides some protection against software piracy, allowing users who wish to reuse the software in new versions without fear of losing their rights to original copies. As with any contract, a contract must be terminated when an employee does not satisfy its terms. In general, once a contract is terminated, the employee is no longer legally responsible for certain actions or transactions. This also means that the employee may take legal action against the issuer. However, there are certain circumstances ( usually due to an employee ’ s failure to pay the contract ) in which the termination of a contract cannot be deemed. ### Contract

A contract may be concluded in order to facilitate performance by the buyer in return for some payment from the goods or services of the seller, or from the buyer in return for a fee or a guarantee.

A negotiable instrument is a letter, or a bill or other promissory note, or an order or a letter of presentation which a third person can issue as an instrument to enter into.

What Is an Employment Contract?
The employment contract is a contract between an employer and an employee that establishes the terms and conditions of employment. The contract governs all aspects of the relationship between employer and employee. It can provide protection for both parties, protecting the employer from accusations of wage theft. An Employment contract can also be a form of labor law, providing employees with the ability to negotiate a termination clause and/or pay. There are many types of employment contracts. While the legal basis of these obligations often pertains to a person buying a product or service from another party, contracts can also cover agreements relating to property, debt instruments, and services.
The formation and purposes of contracts can be distinguished by the presence or absence of specific elements. These elements include an offer or acceptance; consideration; and a mental capacity of the involved parties.

Contracts are a fundamental aspect of property transactions. They encompass various types of agreements that form the foundation of real estate transactions, including:
1. Express Contracts – These include verbal or written expressions of intent between parties that express a specific arrangement. There may be no written agreement, but the parties must acknowledge their understanding and commitment. Typically, these types of contracts are used for matters such as sales or lease agreements.
2. Informal Contracts – These are more frequently used in personal and intimate relationships as well as professional settings. The parties agree to perform specific tasks and expectations, but do not include a written contract.
3. General Conditions – These are implied agreements that are not explicitly written down

Concept of Due Diligence
The term due diligence denotes a comprehensive and meticulous evaluation of the organization—a process usually conducted prior to starting on a new project or venture. It entails reviewing documentation, interviews, and other sources of information along with identifying potential risks and opportunities that might affect the success of the endeavor. Due diligence is not only necessary for successful adoption of new technologies ; it also assists decision-makers in allocating resources prudently regarding risk factors.

2. Bilateral Agreement
A third type of agreement is a bilateral agreement, which refers to agreements between two distinct parties who have in common. The main purpose of a bilateral agreement is to expand the scope of agreement and allow for trade between two parties who have no common interest. For instance, the United States would sign a formal agreement with Canada over access and trade in technology in this form. Similarly, the Japanese firm would establish a contract with Hong Kong’s government to facilitate trade and investment between the two countries. This type of agreement involves both parties as a single legal entity. The specific details of bilateral agreements can vary based on the parties involved, but they generally follow the same general framework.

8. What are the factors to consider when determining how much equity an organization should have in its subsidiary?
An organization should consider whether the subsidiary is worth its total shareholders’ equity and whether the risk associated with acquiring the subsidiary outweighs its value in assets or in other respects. A high risk and high value for the assets of the subsidiary will require that the new organization has more equity exposure than that of the parent.
